input: A coconut seller has to transport coconuts using either <var>rickshaws</var> or <var>ox carts</var>. The <var>rickshaws</var> can take <param>50</param> <obj_name>coconuts</obj_name> each and cost $<param>10</param> per trip. The <var>ox carts</var> can take <param>30</param> <obj_name>coconuts</obj_name> each and cost $<param>8</param> per trip. The seller has <const_dir>at most</const_dir> $<limit>200</limit> to spend on transporting the coconuts. Due to pollution, the number of <var>rickshaws</var> <const_dir>must not exceed</const_dir> the number of <var>ox carts</var>. Formulate a LP to <obj_dir>maximize</obj_dir> the <obj_name>number of coconuts</obj_name> that can be transported.

A furniture store only stocks and sells <var>dining tables</var> and <var>chairs</var>. The <obj_name>profit</obj_name> per <var>dining table</var> is $<param>350</param> and the <obj_name>profit</obj_name> per <var>chair</var> is $<param>75</param>. There is <limit>500</limit> sq ft of space <const_dir>available</const_dir> and a <var>dining table</var> requires <param>8</param> sq ft of floor space while a <var>chair</var> requires <param>2</param> sq ft. Because <var>chairs</var> sell in larger quantities, <const_dir>at least</const_dir> <limit>70%</limit> of all furniture in the store must be <var>chairs</var>. In terms of capital, a <var>dining table</var> ties up $<param>1000</param> in capital and a <var>chair</var> ties up $<param>150</param> in capital. The company wants a <const_dir>maximum</const_dir> of $<limit>20000</limit> worth of capital tied up at any time. Formulate an LP to <obj_dir>maximize</obj_dir> <obj_name>profit</obj_name>.

A bakery sells two types of cakes. They sell a <var>chocolate cake</var> and a <var>vanilla cake</var>. Let's say they make x1 <var>chocolate cakes</var>, at a <obj_name>profit</obj_name> of $<param>10</param> each, and x2 <var>vanilla cakes</var>, at a <obj_name>profit</obj_name> of $<param>11</param> each (x1 and x2 are unknowns both greater than or equal to 0). The daily demand for these cakes is <const_dir>at most</const_dir> <limit>50</limit> <var>chocolate cakes</var> and <const_dir>at most</const_dir> <limit>30</limit> <var>vanilla cakes</var>. The bakery is short staffed and can make a <const_dir>maximum</const_dir> of <limit>50</limit> cakes of either type per day. How much of each cake should the bakery make in order to <obj_dir>maximize</obj_dir> <obj_name>profit</obj_name>?
output:
max: 10 chocolate_cakes + 11 vanilla_cakes
st: chocolate_cakes <= 50
vanilla_cakes <= 30
chocolate_cakes + vanilla_cakes <= 50

input: A company wants to advertise its product. They want to use three types of ads: <var>magazine ads</var>, <var>flyers</var>, and <var>billboard ads</var>. The cost for each option along with the expected viewership is given. A <var>magazine ad</var> costs $<param>1000</param> and attracts <param>10000</param> <obj_name>viewers</obj_name>. A <var>flyer</var> costs $<param>200</param> and attracts <param>5000</param> <obj_name>viewers</obj_name>. A <var>billboard ad</var> costs $<param>7000</param> and attracts <param>25000</param> <obj_name>viewers</obj_name>. To avoid annoying customers, the city has <const_dir>limited the number</const_dir> of <var>flyers</var> from a single company to <limit>8</limit>. In addition, <const_dir>at most</const_dir> a <limit>third</limit> of the total number of ads should be <var>billboard ads</var> and <const_dir>at least</const_dir> <limit>15%</limit> of the ads should be <var>magazine ads</var>. If the weekly <const_dir>budget</const_dir> is $<limit>50000</limit>, how many ads of each type should be run in order to <obj_dir>maximize</obj_dir> the number of <obj_name>viewers</obj_name>?
output:
max: 10000 magazine_ad + 5000 flyer + 25000 billboard_ad
st: flyers <= 8

input: A spicy paste is to be made from units of <var>peppers</var> and <var>tomatoes</var> and is to contain a <const_dir>minimum</const_dir> of <limit>130</limit> units of spice and <limit>90</limit> units of flavor. <var>Peppers</var> <obj_name>cost</obj_name> $<param>8</param> per unit and <var>tomatoes</var> <obj_name>cost</obj_name> $<param>5</param> per unit. A suit store makes <var>2-piece</var> and <var>3-piece suits</var>. To make a <var>2-piece suit</var> requires <param>1</param> hour of measuring and <param>4</param> hours of stitching. A clothing factory makes <var>t-shirts</var> and <var>hoodies</var> with images of super heroes on them using a printing machine. A cell-phone company makes <var>foldable</var> and <var>regular</var> cell-phones in a factory that is divided into a hardware and software section. Each <var>Gilgamesh Supreme</var> sold yields a <obj_name>profit</obj_name> of $<param>2500</param> <obj_name>profit</obj_name>. A factory in India produces <var>rice</var> and <var>corn</var>. How many kilograms of each should the factory make in order to <obj_dir>maximize</obj_dir> <obj_name>profit</obj_name>?

David likes to mix his two post workout drinks: <var>coconut water</var> and <var>blue energade</var>. <var>Coconut water</var> <obj_name>costs</obj_name> $<param>3</param> per bottle, contains <param>5</param> units of potassium, <param>3</param> units of magnesium, and <param>8</param> units of calcium. <var>Blue energade</var> <obj_name>costs</obj_name> $<param>5</param> per bottle and contains <param>10</param> units of potassium, <param>4</param> units of magnesium, and <param>4</param> units of calcium. George <const_dir>has</const_dir> <limit>120</limit> acres of farmland on which to grow <var>strawberries</var> and <var>watermelons</var> Both fruits have to be watered and sprayed with bug repellant. Bold Tycoon wants to put his $<limit>10,000</limit> to work and decides to <const_dir>invest</const_dir> his money in <var>GICs</var> and <var>index ETF</var>. <var>GICs</var>  yields a <param>2%</param> <obj_name>return</obj_name> whereas <var>index ETF</var> yields an average <obj_name>return</obj_name> of <param>7.5%</param>. Two brothers, John and William, run a stand selling <var>lemonade</var> and <var>brownies</var>. A meat processing plant has a machine that makes <var>ham</var> and <var>bacon</var>. input: A software company has <var>UI designers</var> <obj_name>earning</obj_name> $<param>2500</param> per week and <var>software engineers</var> <obj_name>earning</obj_name> $<param>2000</param> per week. A company makes <var>raincoats</var> and <var>umbrellas</var> with images of Latin alphabet on them using a printing machine. input: A TCM company makes powdered medicine in two different packages, a <var>regular package</var> and <var>premium package</var>, to sell to TCM doctors. The <var>regular package</var> requires <param>100</param> g of medicinal herbs and <param>30</param> seconds of drying. A company is delivering packages using two methods, <var>drones</var> and <var>couriers</var>. A vending machine supplier is purchasing vending machines and they can buy a <var>double-load</var> or <var>single-load model</var>.
